subject: AW: [junit] Re: Programming By Contract
msgSnippet: ... If the users of the system are happy with this too, no problem. But in some cases it might be more appropriate to inform the user in a more
messageBody:
> Of course I do, but if it's a pathological case (and assertions are
> only there for pathological cases) I'm happy to bomb out all the way
> to the top and dump a stack trace to the log (which the JVM does for
> me).

If the users of the system are happy with this too, no problem. But in some
cases it might be more appropriate to inform the user in a more
user-understandable way about what happend and how they should handle the
situation.

> If it's not a pathological case, I don't use an assertion, I
> throw some checked exception, catch it, log it and recover.

Fully agreed!

ciao, Ilja
